snippet: Where Sunni and Shiite singers once aimed their barbed lyrics at Israel, they now increasingly target each other.
abstract: Lebanese singer Ali Barakat angers Syrian rebels with song he recorded and posted online that praises Hezbollah and urges it to defeat rebels in Syrian border town of Yabroud; song inspires musical rejoinders as Sunni and Shiite singers increasingly refocus their criticism from Israel onto each other.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Where Sunni and Shiite singers once aimed their barbed lyrics at Israel, they now increasingly target each other.

headline.main: Pro-Hezbollah Song Opens Musical Front in Civil War Over Syria
headline.print_headline: Song Opens Musical Front in Civil War Over Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
